*EDIT: Shoora came in and received her free pizza that I offered. Hopefully this one was up to your expectations. Hi Shoora, I'm sorry the pizza didn't meet your expectations. The mushroom pizza you purchased is isn't really the sauciest of pizzas to begin with but we will look at that pizza to see what we can improve. The sauce is made by mixing ricotta with whipped cream, garlic salt and pepper so you there wouldn't be ricotta dollops on the pizza. As for the mushrooms, we use cremini both cooked and raw as well as portobello which are not inexpensive. The pizza costs $31 but with the ranch and tax it that would be about $40. For the ranch, we just upsized our containers so I wouldn't consider it a small container. We also make it in-house with lots of good ingredients like 14% sour cream Hellmans mayo, dijon mustard as well as fresh chives and basil. I think it is a pretty good price for a dip made from scratch and not out of a bottle.
